result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alonzo Northern III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alonzo Northern III appeared by video, in custody.  
Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Alonzo Northern III.  
Attorney Paul Christopher Dedinsky in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for an Arraignment. 
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and awaiting for a Global Offer. 
Court authorizes transfer to Branch 10 for purposes of a global resolution 
Court will accept Branch 10 case to resolve globally with case before this court. 
Court ordered case adjourned.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alonzo Northern III not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Alonzo Northern III.  Attorney Paul Christopher Dedinsky in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for arraignment.  Court is in trial on another matter and rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Arraignment scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alonzo Northern III appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Alonzo Northern III.  Attorney Paul Christopher Dedinsky in court for State of Wisconsin.
Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #21CF1232 & 21CF2105. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Shipman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defense requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Arraignment scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alonzo Northern III not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III appeared by video for Alonzo Northern III.  Prosecuting attorney Paul Christopher Dedinsky appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case called on the record to set Preliminary Hearing, due to clerical error when setting date at Initial Appearance.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No driving without a valid license.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Alonzo Northern in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Alonzo Northern in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
